items.sentence: I think that it's time for me to get a new email address.
I said something I thought was funny, but nobody laughed.
Tom doesn't usually eat anything before he goes on stage.
Tom pretended he didn't know what Mary was talking about.
Tom isn't violent and he never picks fights with anybody.
Tom isn't a lazy boy. As a matter of fact, he works hard.
I suspect that Tom and Mary are both allergic to peanuts.
Tom asked Mary why she didn't want to go to John's party.
It makes no difference to me whether you kiss Tom or not.
I think there are a lot of good-looking men in Australia.
Tom and I ate dinner without saying a word to each other.
Tom always used to kiss me goodbye when he left for work.
Tom and I are planning to get married on Valentine's Day.
Tom didn't realize that Mary was waiting for him outside.
Tom wasn't the only one who was busy. Mary was busy, too.
It seems that things have really worked out well for you.
I suspect Tom and Mary will have to do that on their own.
Scream and cry as much as you want. Nobody will hear you.

Tom promised himself he'd study harder for the next test.
